intro: Phoebe salvadorensis, commonly known as the Salvadoran phoebe, is a species of flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Lauraceae, which includes laurels and cinnamon trees. The plant is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an important component of the local ecosystem.
